skill.name: using-beads-bv
skill.description: Use when coordinating dependency-aware task planning with beads (bd) CLI and bv graph sidecar - covers ready work selection, priority management, and robot flags for deterministic outputs

skill.author: AgentWorkforce

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance for using beads/bv CLI tools. No executable code, no network calls, no file system access, no command execution. Risk level is safe.

content.value_statement: Manage complex multi-agent workflows with dependency tracking. Beads provides a lightweight issue database where bd CLI handles task management and bv delivers graph metrics for execution planning with deterministic robot flags.
actual_capabilities: Find issues ready to work using `bd ready`
View issue details with dependencies via `bd show <id>`
View graph metrics (PageRank, critical path, cycles) with `bv --robot-insights`
Create and manage dependent issues with `bd create` and `bd dep add`
Claim and close work items with `bd update` and `bd close`
limitations: Requires beads and bv CLI tools to be installed
Interactive TUI will block sessions without `--robot-*` flags
Does not replace TodoWrite for simple single-session tasks
Depends on proper beads database setup for dependency tracking

best_practices: Always use `--robot-*` flags with bv to avoid blocking TUI sessions
Use P0-P4 numeric priorities instead of high/medium/low labels
Include beads issue IDs (e.g., bd-123) in all commit messages for traceability
Run `bd sync` before ending any session to commit changes
anti_patterns: Using bv without robot flags and getting stuck in interactive TUI
Managing tasks in markdown files instead of beads database
Missing issue IDs in commit messages breaks traceability
Using high/medium/low priority labels instead of P0-P4 format

faq.question: What are the P0-P4 priority levels?
faq.answer: P0 blocks everything (critical), P1 needs immediate attention, P2 is standard work, P3 is nice to have, P4 is future backlog.

faq.question: How do I avoid blocking in bv?
Can I use this for single-agent tasks?
faq.answer: No. Use TodoWrite for simple single-session tasks. Beads is designed for multi-agent coordination with dependencies.

faq.question: How do I create dependent issues?
faq.answer: Create both issues with `bd create`, then link them with `bd dep add <depends-on-id> <issue-id>`.

faq.question: What data does this skill access?
faq.answer: This is a documentation-only skill. It describes how to use beads/bv CLI tools which access your local beads database.

faq.question: How is this different from TodoWrite?
faq.answer: TodoWrite is for personal task tracking. Beads is for shared, dependency-aware task management across multiple agents and sessions.
